hackathon-eligibility: All previously registered and RSVPd students can take part.
hackathon-requirements:
- YOU MUST BE REGISTERED FOR HACKDAVIS TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION. (Checked in with a wristband)
- You cannot work on your project before hacking begins (which is officially 12:00pm PT on Saturday, January 21st, 2017) 
- You must submit your project by 11:30 AM on Sunday, January 22nd. You can continue hacking until noon or until countdown goes to 0. 
- You cannot steal another team's code in any way, shape, or form 
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Fire tablets for each team member + Tour / Personal Info Session with GSV CEO
1st place: 4 smart watches; 2nd / 3rd place: Swag bags - Sponsored by Google
$500 among the winning team - sponsored by Esri
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of ArcGIS Developer Platform

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Amazon Echoes for each team member - Sponsored by Amazon Alexa
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Amazon Alexa Voice

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 for 1st place; $300 for 2nd place; $200 for 3rd place - sponsored by OSISoft
Admission into summer academy of MakeSchool - sponsored by MakeSchool
Full access to Wolfram Development Platform - sponsored by Wolfram Alpha
Raspberry PI 3 Starter Kits for the team - Sponsored by IBM
1st Place get an Electron + Asset Tracker + swag;
Domain.com swag bags for each team member - sponsored by MLH
Hack Harassment Battery Packs for each team member - sponsored by MLH
$250 in AWS credit for the team - sponsored by MLH
Holy Stone Drones for each team member.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Hacks that are more difficult to implement will be scored highly. Impressive architecture, technical difficulty, and solving hard problems are all important parts of a successful hack. Using more advanced technologies is also a plus.

We want HackDavis to be an environment that encourages highly innovative and different ideas, so we will be keeping an eye out for ideas that pique our interest or make us see the space or problem differently.
HackDavis is a hackathon about social good. The hacks that most benefit our nonprofits, make a positive impact on the local community, and benefit humanity as a whole will score some major points.

hackathon-description-header: UC Davis's annual major collegiate hackathon is back with 3 tracks: education, environment, and health.
